resources.string: TechJourneyCompanion
XML, or Extensible Markup Language, is a widely used markup language designed to structure, store, and transport data in a human-readable and machine-readable format.
Key Characteristics of XML:
Tags and Elements: XML documents use tags to enclose data elements. Tags are enclosed in angle brackets and can be nested to represent hierarchical relationships.
Reasons Why XML is Needed for Designing Front End:

Declarative Layout Definition:\n\nXML: XML provides a declarative way to define UI layouts using tags and attributes, making it straightforward to describe the structure and appearance of UI elements..
Learning Sites:
- W3Schools XML Tutorial:\n\nURL: https://www.w3schools.com/xml
Java

Java is the official programming language for Android app development.

 It is used for building the core functionality and front-end design of Android apps.

 Java's Android framework includes UI components, layouts, views, and more for creating interactive user interfaces.
Some of the fundamentals of the Java programming language include :

1. Packages
 2. Objects and classes
 3. Inheritance and interfaces
 4. Strings and numbers, generics
 5. Collections
 6. Concurrency
Some links to learn Java programming language include :

1. https://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/

 2. https://www.udacity.com/course/java-programming-basics--ud282/

 3. https://www.vogella.com/tutorials/android.html/

 4. https://www.w3schools.com/java/

Attributes: Elements in XML can have attributes that provide additional information about the data they represent. Attributes are specified within the opening tag of an element.
Hierarchical Structure: XML documents have a hierarchical structure where elements can have parent-child relationships, forming a tree-like structure.
Human-Readable and Machine-Readable: XML is designed to be both readable by humans and processable by machines, making it suitable for data interchange.
Flexibility: XML allows you to define custom tags and structures, making it adaptable to different data formats and requirements
